title: 108_s2846
content: The Act is titled the "Nye County Higher Education Campus Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms. The "Nye County Higher Education Campus Conveyance Act" defines key terms such as Chancellor, County, College, Federal land, Map, State, and University system. The term "University system" refers to the University and Community College System of Nevada. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE TO THE UNIVERSITY AND COMMUNITY COLLEGE SYSTEM OF NEVADA. The Secretary shall convey Federal land to the University system for use as a campus for the College within 1 year of survey approval. The Chancellor must agree to pay administrative costs associated with the conveyance. The Federal land will be conveyed to the University system for the College campus, to be used for educational and recreational purposes. The University must release and indemnify the United States from any liabilities, erect a monument acknowledging the conveyance, and assist the Bureau of Land Management. The University system will use the Federal land for the College campus, including educational, recreational, residential, and commercial purposes. The conveyance is subject to valid existing rights, and the University must assist the Bureau of Land Management in providing information on public land and its management. The University system may lease property at the College to various groups for services and events, allow the County to use facilities for programs, and collaborate with the County on planning and financing. In conjunction with the County, facilities for educational or recreational purposes can be constructed and operated on Federal land. If the land ceases to be used for the College, it may revert to the United States at the Secretary's discretion.
